website_summaries.verdict: One of the better beginner-friendly and budget-friendly projectors for people looking for a good first-time model.
pros: Projector offers a good amount of control over the picture settings such as brightness and contrast
Can project the image to screens up to 300 inches
cons: The screen adjustability for projecting the correct image from an angle is limited

customer_reviews.title: Pros: Relatively Quiet Clean Aesthetic Look Bright, while ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Relatively Quiet Clean Aesthetic Look Bright, while maintaining a decent contrast level for a sub $1000 projector Plenty of modern and older connections Cons: Slightly odd mounting holes Menus aren't the most intuitive ( you have to go several levels deep to figure out how to rotate the screen)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler A. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great picture with excellent contrast but EXTREMELY low audio output problems!
customer_reviews.text: This is nearly unusable for home theater, the audio output is at 1/2 line level at full volume! Even running to an amplifier at full volume it is barely audible. Got this to replace my Optoma at the same settings that projector would have you diving for ear protection. Sadly, with fantastic image quality this is heartbreaking. If I can’t find a solution to this it will be going back. :(
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha B

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bright, clear picture at 1080p, even on the Eco setting. Fan is very quiet. Overall, great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Rader

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It is now 2 years old and it is still trucking along. :) Love the brightness, we are projecting to a 110-inch fixed screen. Colors are pretty exquisite, and still much cheaper than a TV. :) I just bought the 2020 model for my husband's game/music room. We bought this for our home theater. It's a powerful little gadget. We haven't installed light blocking curtains on our windows and there is a big one right where this projector is and this baby can hold its own with ambient lighting filtering through our cellular shades. We also use it for gaming and have not had any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: AV Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brightness, contrast and clarity
customer_reviews.text: Very good. I got this for my shop and there is some stray light. The first projector I got was horrible. Claimed 4000 lumens. Not even close. This one blows the doors off that one. The photo shows the two images projected on the wall. On the right is the bad one. On the left is this BenQ. It's like 5X brighter. And the clarity of the text is amazing. The contrast is amazing. (note, the wall I projected on is just the shop wall. There are marks and holes in it).
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I needed to replace an inexpensive old Acer projector that died. I tried a less expensive projector for about a week and got fed up with the noisy fan and blurry picture - at $300 it was worse than my old Acer. So I sent back the "cheap" one and committed to the BenQ. Wow, what a difference!!! It's so bright and crisp, and the fan noise is barely noticeable. We use this in our living room which has a moderate amount of natural light, mostly shaded by big trees - I'm really pleased by the color and picture quality we get without darkening the room. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Yuzu

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as baseline epson
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this is getting great reviews. For 1080p streaming movies it is fine. 1080i TV is flat out terrible. Contrast blares and the picture has greenish tint. My low price epson I bought 5 years ago is still better than this. I see rainbow constantly and the picture while watching sports has no sharpness. The brightness feature is also weak. Some calibration settings cannot be used except for the best of signals so you can't correct many TV broadcasts. Thinking of returning. Not sure if my unit is defective but I am pretty sure it just isn't very good. Imo not very bright for the lumens stated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!
customer_reviews.text: If I had to gripe about this projector it would be the lack of instruction. The quick set-up guide is useless and the other manual does not tell you anything you need to know. When I ceiling mounted it, the picture was not only upside-down, but mirrored as well! Try reading that! Once I got it flipped after some cursing, I was able to slowly figure it out and adjust things accordingly. The picture is lovely and the projector is quiet. Hint: if the fan is running fast and you don't know why, check the menu and make sure it is not on the high altitude setting.
customer_reviews.author: zozo

customer_reviews.title: Bright picture. Outstanding clarity. Great colors.
customer_reviews.text: What a light cannon! I enjoy watching TV in my living room that has a wall of floor to ceiling windows. No problem! Of course, the blacks are blacker at night. But, for all sports and all but the blackest movie scenes, this projector shows a great 120" picture on my textured wall in the middle of the day. Amazing. Colors are great too. With other projectors I've had to put blankets over the windows for daytime viewing. Not anymore. Also, with previous projectors it seemed I could never get sharp text and clarity no matter what I did. But this projector snaps right into focus and stays sharp even when adjusting size. How do they do that?
customer_reviews.author: Mike Muecke

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good picture.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my ‘media room’ and it projects a nice picture. I read lots of reviews before buying a projector but really don’t have a point of reference other than our wall mounted flat screen TVs. They are easier to watch when there is ambient light but I put this projector in the basement where I could control the amount of incoming light and it does well. I purchased a 110” screen and together they do a good job even with fast motion and dark scenes. It was easy to mount and set up. The remote is a bit cheesy and it could have more HDMI ports.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Clear, bright awesome projector
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this projector after debating between Epson 1060 and this one. I am not disappointed. Its a great projector. Its super bright and the picture is real clear. I honestly am surprised at the HD picture. I use it with my Roku stick and figured out how to extract audio to a bluetooth speaker. Its awesome. I would recommend it. I had a backyard cinema night and my guest were amazed at the quality of the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Belen R

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice unit for the cost. I have had this almost a year and it still has a great picture. A couple times it didn’t turn on and a red light was blinking, but I just unplugged it and turned it back on again and back to normal. You can spend thousands on a projector that might give you a little sharper picture, but for the money it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Mihigloria3

customer_reviews.title: Benq Projector Yes!! This reseller NOOOOO
customer_reviews.text: This projector is kind of Big for portability. The lens for short throw feature really makes the difference on this projector. Good quality picture, easy to work with although the remote control works when the IR is in front of it. Generates quite some heat, so having the right amount of air will be a must to keep the Projector cooling. Colors are bright and vivid. It was really easy to set up. By this projector directly from BenQ or Amazon. This reseller sent me refurbished projector although never was disclosed. This Seller does not compliance with Amazon best practice. A case to AMazon Customer was escalated as the reseller never replied back en
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the picture quality and brightness. Directions leave something to be desired. I don't think it has a screen trigger outlet. Don't get it if you want to use the internal speakers, they are a joke. It is quite large compared to my older BenQ projector which has been a great piece of equipment, I hope this one is as well.
customer_reviews.author: YT

customer_reviews.title: Great for home theater
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my Benq PB6200 for home theater. I run it at 135"... Great picture! Sound output from projector through audio receiver... Great sound! ... True theater experience! No issues... Recommend 100%!
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Can't touch this for the money.. Outstanding picture
customer_reviews.text: Audio is poor, but for a home theater where you will be using a sound system anyway it's not an issue (hence the 5 star rating).. The picture is outstanding.. Replaced a 4 year old projector that cost me over $1,000 and the picture on this blows it away (even when it was brand new). Not too many picture controls, but the projector does a good job of self governing the picture. 1080P movies look absolutely amazing... Ceiling mounted projecting on a 9 ft. diagonal screen. Projector is 12 feet from screen. There is a manual zoom which is great for adjusting the size of the picture to fit your screen perfectly...
customer_reviews.author: Marvfod

customer_reviews.title: Solid, bright, FHD projector
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture. Plenty of brightness in moderately lit room, and even better in a dark room. I have no idea what flaws a videophile/expert might find, but for those of us wanting an excellent general purpose projector for TV/movies/presentations, this is a great product for the money. I'll guess others have a set up like mine -- HDMI inputs come from Cable box, BluRay player, and Amazon FireStick into an AV receiver -- a single HDMI output from receiver goes to projector for video; the audio plays from speakers powered by the receiver -- very basic and effective setup for home theater
customer_reviews.author: CardioDad

customer_reviews.title: Holy wah! An excellent inexpensive projector.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to catch a good deal on this projector. After going back and forth in a few different models in the $600 range I pulled the trigger on this one because of good reviews across the web, and a spectacular price. The picture is fantastic. Given the layout of the room it went into I went with a 100" screen. It's mounted 142" away. The picture is bright, even on Eco mode. The only bad thing I have to say is I wish there was a little more finer control as far the picture goes, but it's still a fine picture with the limited control.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Too aggressive for my eyes
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and picture was superb, but it was just too bright for my brain and eyes. Induced eye strain and headache and this was after turning off the bright mode, setting it to Cinema, and then also cranking the brightness from its setting of 50 down to 40. I think this projector (2017 model) has more business/presentation in its blood than home theater. I suspect the white segment of the color wheel is oversized to boost its lumens. At any rate, I couldn't keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic low light performance
customer_reviews.text: The projector works great in low light settings, but the instructions are pictures and tables, very unuseful. Also the audio out is a joke, I only use it as a projector running a firestick through my Oppo UPD 203 which sends audio to an audiophile stereo setup. I purchased it on Amazon, I could return it, but I doubt I can get anything better for 433 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: yaniman

customer_reviews.title: Hot
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, cost effective projector. The image is good. Ré not so good: 1. This is supposed to be medium range, but I find it has to be a long ways from the wall to project a large image 2. This thing is a little heater. I suppose it has to do with those 3000 lumens, but it can make a room significantly hotter in the summer
customer_reviews.author: Maicol

customer_reviews.title: Bright & clear!
customer_reviews.text: During my A schools I used the AAXA picos for portability but now I have a permanent home my wife and I decided to commit and upgrade. This projector is BRIGHT! We have ours in our living room which is well lit at all times because of the windows and the picture quality does not suffer. We also have it about 25 feet from the wall which is pretty impressive. The only downside is it doesn’t have a built in USB for the fire stick. Will upload pictures ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Kieran Brandjes

customer_reviews.title: Great projector but...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I love this projector. The picture quality is great. Brightness is great. Color reproduction is great. Really the only issue that I have is the fan. It’s a bit louder than another projector I tried out from a competitor but not enough to be a deal breaker. However, over the last couple of weeks, the fan has started making this awful high pitched ringing/rattling sound. It’s really almost brought to make me want to send it back. I’ll give it a week or two more, but it’s more than likely going back if this continues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: The picture is great! Even in daylight it still shows relatively well. I have it celling mounted right above where we sit. I have an HDMI switch with optical out on the switch connected to a Logitech z5500 surround sound system. The only complaint I have would be the fan sometimes sounds like its off tilt and other times gets quite loud even on eco. For the price and picture quality, I don't think you can beat it. Its a great projector for watching movies, GOT, gaming (PC, PS4, Switch).
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great image and brightness and low noise. Watch out for the throw distance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and I’m loving it. Image quality is great and brightness allows me to use it even when barbecuing with the curtains to the outside open. Its noise level is also very low. The reason I gave four stars was because the throw table measurements were not correct. It is producing an image about 3 in wider than my screen with minimum zoom when, according to the table, it should be even smaller with this zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Armando H.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. Bought it for the kids for camping and it was an absolute hit. In the middle of nowhere watching big screen movies and eating popcorn. Setup was a breeze with many different connection options. Lots of picture adjustment and brightness alternatives with a bright and crisp picture. Perfect unit for mid to serious picture quality buffs. The one and only drawback is sound volume. On board speaker is pretty lousy. I planned on using my Bose Sound Link anyway which worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Marino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector for the money, volume is a tad low
customer_reviews.text: This is one crazy-good projector! I have a smaller, cheaper $80 projector that you needed pitch black to be able to see a decent picture. The BenQ was super bright during daylight and without a projector screen! The ONLY issue I have (which others have echoed) is the volume: the sound output, even to external speakers, is very low. I have to crank the volume all the way up on speakers to be able to hear at medium. Otherwise, this will be great for backyards parties, indoor, the garage, you name it!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: BenQ makes awesome projectors
customer_reviews.text: This projector's picture was fantastic! BenQ knows what they are doing. The brightness was stunning and the color saturation was pretty incredible for this price point. I loved the variety of connections and ease of menu use. I ended up returning it only due to the fact that I misunderstood or mistakenly thought it have vertical lens shift which in hindsight is kind of funny since you don't get stuff like that until you spend hundreds of dollars more, but it doesn't change the fact that this is a great entry-level home theater projector and deserves a good rating!
customer_reviews.author: _SeriousSam_

customer_reviews.title: One of the cheapest 1080p project
customer_reviews.text: Very bright but I'm not happy with the picture quality. I already own OPTOMA HD 141x, picture quality is way more better. If you are tight on the budget, can go for this one. Other issue I found was the audio out, if you are connecting external audio source, sound is somehow half suppressed, I see another user also reporting same issue, really wonder how can BenQ do this blunder. Pros: Brightness, low cost for 1080p projector Cons: Picture quality is not upto the mark, Audio out bug
customer_reviews.author: Rachit

customer_reviews.title: Best budget 1080p projector
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research, and this is truly the best 1080p projector for the price. Got a 100'' screen going about 10 feet back from the wall. Just be aware, like others have noted, that you will need to pair this with a A/V receiver. The audio out (aux) port has very low volume, and even using bluetooth adapters will not give you loud enough sound. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Bright and beautiful picture. Questionable quality build
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality and of this projector is unquestionable. However, after owning it for 18 months I've had to replace the bulb (under warranty) once and it is acting up again in the exact same way. I have it in a hanging installation and watch an average of 20 hours a week in eco mode. That's 1000 hours a year or 10% of a 10,000 rated lamp. 2020 Update: This is the third time and the lamp is doing the same thing and this is a replacement unit. Benq support has been great but their product is questionable.

customer_reviews.title: A very good daytime projector
customer_reviews.text: I am looking for a daytime projector with high lumens, mainly because it’s our kid who watch it the most. However most ones with 3000 lumens has low resolution. Thus I narrow my search down to 3000+ lumens with 1080p. We are not a home theatre fan thus we do not focus on the 4K ones. Here I found this one. Perfect for daytime use with our lights on. It’s clear enough to watch some TV episodes. We are very satisfied with it. Btw, we don’t have the problem with the sound, although it is indeed not that high enough.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: Just started building my screen room and the projector is excellent for my 13x13 space. It projects a 100” picture with no problem and the dial could project bigger at the 11-foot projector-to-screen distance. The screen is made of acoustically transparent spandex and compares favorably to the expensive acoustic screens I viewed before deciding on the DIY route. This BENQ MH535FHD is an excellent value. And it has a 3-year warranty. Very good value and I am extremely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: David Paterson

customer_reviews.title: Great for large dark rooms.
customer_reviews.text: If your living arrangement includes a room that is large and dark, you owe it to yourself to add a projector to your home theatre setup. The main drawback of this model is the lack of audio options, which I solved by buying a good bluetooth adapter and a soundbar. You will also want a projector screen for the best experience. The end result is 120 inches of awesome picture and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schroder

customer_reviews.title: Incredible brightness and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This projector is my 3rd Ive owned. They were a BenQ and Espon. This projector blew me away at the level of brightness and picture quality. Its like a true LCD flat screen. Even day time use is hardly washed out. I knew this unit was going to be brighter than my last one. But in no way was I expecting what this unit puts out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: This projector has a great picture, fan is quiet and it looks good even with some room lighting on. We have it ceiling mounted (there are 3 mounting holes on the bottom and you can set up the picture flip in the settings)... Also there are many settings to be able to customize the picture for your needs as well as a neat future of eco mode which is supposed to extend the life of the lamp- I don't notice too much of a difference between eco and normal. Good solid projector and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a short throw 1080p projector
customer_reviews.author: T kam

customer_reviews.title: First and only projector I will own.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this projector for a couple months now. The image is spectacular and the don't have many complaints. Obviously the brightness is best when in a dark room, but even in a well lit room you can still see a great picture. Only complaints would be that it doesn't have a USB port to power a casting device as well as the speaker that's integrated isn't very loud. So you'll need a sound system. Other than that definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Javi L.

customer_reviews.title: Great business projector
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered and returned a different projector with similar specs, but far poorer performance. Beware the low-price, no-name models. The BenQ MH535FHD, however, is as advertised. If I needed another, I'd get another of these. Definitely recommended. This one is in use in our office, in a room that always has sunlight, and is unevenly lit. It's a great space with character...but it's a challenge for a projector. The MH535FHD is sufficiently bright for viewing in a lit room, it doesn't emit any noticeable fan noise, and text is sharp and readable for everyone in the room. If your needs are similar, this should be a strong consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Usually a critic

customer_reviews.title: Theatre quality
customer_reviews.text: I’d consider this a mid ranged priced projector. man is the picture beautiful. I’d suggest buying a sound at or speakers tho, because the speakers on the projector are pathetic. But I already knew I’d buy speakers anyways so that’s no issue for me. I upside down mounted it on a 110 inch projector screen and get nothing but compliments. It’s superb. Why spend any more money than this, because its very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: update! less than 1 year and dead
customer_reviews.text: the 3d is great, so clear and immersive. have this in my shop and with garage doors open can still see picture no problem. 3d syncs right up, and set up was real easy. way better than the cheap projector i had, no comparison update, good luck finding a bulb or even what type of bulb to get uhp 210 good luck finding one that fits 9 months old and overheat light comes on after 5 seconds shuts off its sunday so will see tomorrow how benq handles this
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality and setup is great. The only thing this projector is missing is sound output. I thought I could fix the sound output with a speaker system but it is incredibly quiet still. Recommend for picture, but I would go with Optoma if you want to be able to hear anything.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kimble

customer_reviews.title: I am selling My TV now..
customer_reviews.text: OMG..!!! I absolutely love tv and believed there's no device which could replace my love for it but then my husband went for this projector. I received like an hour back and we set it up to test. I totally love it and may give up my tv ;) Pros: -Super huge screen of 300" diagonally -quick and easy settings to adjust screen and resolution -very easy to setup -firestick amd other such devices are plug and play -Inbuilt speakers Cons: -Speaker volume is pretty low -Can't project on ceiling as there's support for back, you can definitely do it with work arounds -no UHD support yet
customer_reviews.author: Jyoti Kushwaha

customer_reviews.title: The picture right out of the box is first rate
customer_reviews.text: The color and resolution are both outstanding. The audio on the unit is inadequate but is easily amplified. having two hdmi inputs is a big plus. The 3300 lumens allows for viewing without darkening the room. Fan noise is minimal and the warranty means I will have this projector for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Messmore

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier with this projector! After reading many reviews out there on this projector and many others, I was pretty nervous, but so happy with my BENQ projector. Picture quality and brightness are great. I have it rear wall mounted upside down. Setup was very easy. I have it set back around 18ft and get approximately 135in picture. Picture quality is still great from that distance. Many mentioned issues with the built in audio. The speaker is very quiet but I didn’t plan to use the projector speaker anyway. I have speakers routed through a stereo receiver and this solves that issue. Sound is great and couldn’t be happier with our home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Beer

customer_reviews.title: Just received it and it is a nice projector. The picture is crisp and the throw ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and it is a nice projector. The picture is crisp and the throw ratio fits my home theater. I would have given it a 5 star if it comes with a HDMI cable and the bulb does not generate that much heat. Who uses VGA cables for home theater as this projector is targeting? If you sit on the right side of the projector, you can have a sauna while enjoying your movie, not great. Definitely, needs to be ceiling mounted and I also will have to wait for a longitudinal test to see if the bulb can last before giving it a 5 star. Good starting score though!
customer_reviews.author: Wing Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Don't let the price fool you. Currently projecting on a light yellow wall, turned the setting on to yellow wall and the image is very crisp. The colors are very vibrant, didn't notice any lag playing PS4 and XBOX on it. Very silent fan, movie nights and sporting events are next level, currently have it projecting about 130 inches. Once I add a screen it will be even more clear, screen isn't 100% necessary though. Very easy setup. Only downside is the sound, but if you're buying a home theater Projector I hope you were planning on getting a sound system anyways. I'm never going back to using a TV in my living room again.
customer_reviews.author: connie melton

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain, look no further
customer_reviews.text: Look it’s not a $1000 projector, but it is awesome for the value!!!!!! Looks better than any of my TVs and I have like 5-6 TVs. Doesn’t have some of the crazy features of a more expensive rig, but very easy to set up. Had mounted and rolling in under five minutes (had a mount already on ceiling for old projector).
customer_reviews.author: william barker

customer_reviews.title: Good value decent picture - Audio not so good, but I don't use the audio.
customer_reviews.text: Use as home theater. The picture is decent and it is very bright. The audio is not very good at all, but I split the audio to my sound system anyway, so not an issue for me. Remote is IR, so if the projector is mounted somewhere where it is hard to point remote directly at, it may not work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Code Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Turned a Living Room into a Theater Room
customer_reviews.text: This projector is amazing for our Living Room upgrade to a Theater Room. I have purchased an 150inch Projector Screen and an entire setup for Dolby Atmos 5.1.2 setup. I turned on the lights on some of the photos to show the wall for scale of size, while the other photos are woth all the lights off to show the clarity of the projection image.
customer_reviews.author: SBCS-TechSales

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality, almost too bright!
customer_reviews.text: To solve the low volume output of the stereo jack, I purchased a line level gain booster from HTD. Great picture quality for the price with excellent brightness. It is almost too bright, so much so that I had to manually adjust the color and brightness as whites were somehow too white even in eco mode. We can use it in a sunlit room or with the lights on if needed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality for Cost
customer_reviews.text: Projector is amazing for the price, I’ve been through 3 projectors. The one I got under $200 had blurry corners and was extremely loud. Then Under $400 had bad cast and was in square presentation mode so wasted screen space. This projector is amazing for throw, quality, and noise.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture horrible auio
customer_reviews.text: Its great. For the price im very content with my purchase. But for the buyers to look out, this models sound output is really really low. I had a 2.0 sound output and they are extremly but i had to change them to meet the projectors needs. So i bought a 1200 watt 5.1 dolby hd surround speaker system and its still not loud enough sometimes to watch a movie ! The aux has a problem and they need to fix this with some sort of an update. The speakers are normally shaking the whole apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Yigit

customer_reviews.title: Big Screen!!!
customer_reviews.text: After my 50" TV died, I'd decided I wanted to put a projector TV in our media room. I woodwork as a hobby, so I made my new 100" screen and researched which projector to buy. I went with this model after lots of research. It appeared to be the best value -- best lumens, best picture, cheap replacement bulb, etc. for the money. I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: captainsparklez

customer_reviews.title: Great projector.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic projector! High definition and great picture quality. It is very bright as well! I had a projector that claimed it was 3800 lumens and this one is way brighter by far! Wide array of colors that are quite accurate. They whites are super bright and the blacks are super dark. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: nf6391

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture. We use it on our outdoor movie screen which is 20'x10'...i am beyond happy with it. Colors are vibrant...picture is clear...3d is awesome My only complaint is the sound, but i run a speaker thru my laptop and problem solved
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Crystal Clear and very bright. This thing is amazing. I have a 55 inch 1080p tv in my living room and this thing looks better than that. I'm casting about a 135 inch screen in the home theater i set up in my basement. The picture is fantastic. I have zero complaints. I've only had it a few days but with a 3 year warranty, i feel pretty comfortable it should be good for a while. I also looked up replacement bulbs and for this one they are around 65 dollars. Very happy with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: picture quality is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This projector's picture quality is so clear. Menu is easy to use. It is simple to setup and focus. I really like how no matter how you zoom the focus does not change. It took all of 30 seconds to align it to my screen. It's very quiet. Guaranteed to make your wife smile.
customer_reviews.author: Omnipotent Perpetual

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine for the price.  Just be sure to add external speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Its great. Very bright even with a significant amount of ambient light. At night you can leave the lights on in the room and it still looks bright. One caveat, the internal speakers are not really usable. You definitely need external speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Great projector for the money. Colors are very accurate. Games no lag. I had a 4K e shift. This projector is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: We've had this projector for about a month and so far so good. It's much brighter and higher contrast than an earlier Epson model we had had for 5 years. It fires up quickly, which was often been problem with the previous unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: If you need to use the 3.5mm audio jack (the only audio output available on the projector) to push your audio to speakers, it only provides 2 watts of power. This is significantly less than a cell phone or any normal 3.5mm audio output, and will not function properly. BenQ tech support is aware of this issue and has no plans to fix it, it's just a faulty product that they have left out on the market.
customer_reviews.author: James Coil

customer_reviews.title: Great picture but poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality picture. The sound is extremely dull compared to new cheaper end projectors that are coming out with high quality sound. This one you absolutely need to hook a stereo up to for the audio output. But on the bright side of things it's a very good quality picture. very impressed by the quality of the picture and I'm running mine in eco mode.
customer_reviews.author: GriswoldStyle Lightorama

customer_reviews.title: You cannot go wrong with this model
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Ordered cheaper one first and it was awful. This picture is outstanding. Get a outdoor speaker and go direct in from laptop or blu Ray for best sound. Bluetooth will give a sound delay.
customer_reviews.author: James Eric Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, great quality, incredible picture
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest purchase of the year. Incredible quality, very bright (can even watch it during the day), and overall just a great product. The audio output was very low - even when hooked up to external speakers. Ended up buying a small amp to boost the sound and it works perfectly now. Highly recommend this to anyone who wants a reasonably price but very high quality projector.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use on special occasions and ended up keeping it out permanently to watch TV show. The picture quality is excellent and we get compliments on it all the time. Watching space shows makes me want to throw up cuz it's so realistic.
customer_reviews.author: Violetmoon

customer_reviews.title: Picture Great / Speaker Blown After 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: The projector's picture quality is great, but the speaker is broken after 3 months. Need to send into BenQ for repairs and the process takes a couple of weeks. Not the greatest experience and hope they can get it fixed. Such a bummer because I had high hopes for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is range of the zoning. I want to place this projector at the end of wall, but the. produces a very large screen, out of my ideal size. In order to make it produce the perfect size, I have to move it forward.
customer_reviews.author: DYU

customer_reviews.title: $600 piece of trash!!
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed the unit, installed my new screen had the projector all set up to watch a movie, 10 minutes into the movie smoke poured out of the projector and a loud banging noise came out of the unit. You can hear broken pieces all inside of the unit from something exploding. $600 projector. $150 outdoor screen. $20 movie rental. Getting to enjoy 10 minutes of the movie. Priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Yingling

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector. Able to use during the day. Picture quality is very good and easy to use. I pair it with my Roku without any issues. Would recommend to anyone interested in making a home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Bulb Went Out
customer_reviews.text: We had this projector for about 7 months and it is now turning off intermittently and telling us the bulb is out. We are surprised because we don't use it that frequently. We would have thought the bulb would last for at least a few years. If it's not the bulb something internal that is going haywire, that is equally concerning. We mounted this when we purchased it so it hasn't even moved since we installed it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my first projector
customer_reviews.text: I debated buying a higher end model, but decided to start with this less expensive option and happy I did. I have this installed in our basement and projected on our white wall without a screen and honestly it looks great. It is setup on a console table behind our couch ~12ft away and gives us a 120" screen. It does struggle with sunlight, but it was expected. Great for movies and sports, I have not gamed on it yet. Setup was easy and straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: J. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: After a month of reading reviews on different products, I chose this. I’m happy with the quality of picture and ease of set up. I would advise to double check your surround sound compatibility. This wasn’t made for hdmi soundbars so it took some extra parts and money to make my setup work. Overall, I would buy BenQ projectors everytime!
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful quality!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture quality! We don't use the projector sound so not sure if that's good quality or not. It works perfectly in our media room 13' from the 110" screen.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: I put this outside in my covered patio, and the picture quality is excellent, but the only downside is that it has to be evening/night time before I can really enjoy it. During the day, even on a cloudy day and with all the shades pulled down, the picture really gets washed out by any ambient light. But that is to be expected with projectors, so overall I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: david brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: First projector in Home absolutely love. Did many comparisons and wasn’t sure. Out of all in its class ranked top in price range. I brought on budget with mind set of selling next year for $1000-$1200 one.. well no need i love this for gaming and movies
customer_reviews.author: Chalhoun

customer_reviews.title: No regrets!!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year and I’m totally good with this purchase. I’ve had a few clitches but nothing that a restart couldn’t handle. The lumen count works great for my unfortunately well lit movie room but this projector does amazingly well. The remote is a bit underdeveloped but it works well enough. No regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Mitchell Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Setup with a ceiling mount and a screen in my bar. Looks awesome!! Very bright! Works in lighted room. Follow everyone's directions for sound. Definitely need the splitter, but if you're getting a projector, you're not going to be using the stock speaker anyways. Straightforward to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: None better at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Wow was I surprised!! The picture is amazing! We have this mounted on the ceiling almost directly above the couch and with the sound on at a normal volume you can barely hear the fan. We have almost 120" display and the image is still very crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to replace Dell projector 4610X we use it as overhead projector on a 10' screen 13 feet away. The screen fit well with 16.10 setting, I used finepx camera to record the DVD coming via VGA cable 13 feet long and the quality is very good, we need to fine tune it for sharper image, but wanted to try it out before making a complete set. Easy to install, no need to adjust anything except to adjust for distance and invert image. Very satisfied with the performance. The video is king of fast moving with Céline Dion in Las Vegas .
customer_reviews.author: Roy Idrach

customer_reviews.title: Say Goodbye to wasting money at the movie theater
customer_reviews.text: As a former projectionist, I am amazed at the clarity and resolution this baby can provide. Even in bright room, there is no impact to picture quality. Benq has impressed me once again
customer_reviews.author: S. Koski

customer_reviews.title: Great projector! Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been streaming outdoor concerts with this projector. It has been great! The picture quality is very good, even during twilight hours. The projector is very easy to use there are lots of connections. I would recommend using an alternate sound source, the sound coming from the projector is not Loud. The audio quality is why I give it four stars, but I run audio from the laptop to other audio source.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B. Swasey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, neat look.
customer_reviews.text: I like this projector. It is a NATIVE 1080p resolution and even when you project the screen to a big surface, the quality stays really good. Though one thing that I miss from this projector (which most projectors at this price-range lack as well) is the that it does not accept a flash-drive with movies on it. But since it has the HDMI, I can get by without it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Used for family night outside
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with picture quality and brightness. We use it outside on a large canvas and the quality is that of a movie theater. Projector is a good 15' away. Very happy with it. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JTEG

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is wow
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow. Sure glad I did my research, picture was spectacular truly made a believer out of my wife she thought a quality picture outdoors wasn’t possible
customer_reviews.author: earl

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant image at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector for screening movies at home. The picture is excellent, with vivid colors and high resolution, even on my beige wall without any screen. My only complaint is that it is a bit noisy, though not enough to bother me or even to be very noticeable while watching something. You will also need a separate speaker as the built-in one is not good, but this is to be expected. Overall I am very satisfied with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture Output, Bad Sound Output - Consider your needs before purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our office purchased for use in lower light rooms specifically for presentation situations. Was easy to set up out of box and produces a bright, crisp picture. However, the speaker is very weak and it was hard to adjust the volume to a level to hear even in a smaller conference room. Luckily, we normally don't use a lot of sound so we will be okay, but consider the lack of speaker volume if you need to use this projector for sound output. For the price I would recommend if it fits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: KBroadway

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this projector, more so than my 65" TV. Other than 4k, HDR (which I don't need) for the price - perfection. Thanks guys! My fiance is going to love this!
customer_reviews.author: Cellularize

customer_reviews.title: Great projector!
customer_reviews.text: We finally set up a projector for our apartment, and the BenQ MH530FHD has been great! We have a bunch of windows that don't have light blocking curtains (or any curtains for that matter in the adjacent open kitchen) but the image still looks decent even during the day. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and portable
customer_reviews.text: Gets pretty big. Bought it for a friend for his own home theater. He loves it. I don't recommend it for gaming unless its something not involving super clear pixels and high refresh rates.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector! Especially for the price. We were looking for an inexpensive (relatively) entry level 1080p projector. We had tried a different one first and it wasn't that great (resolution, noise,...). This is looks great on our 120 inch screen even in smart eco mode, barely makes noise, and was easy to set up. Now I'm ready for GoT Season 8 (and Avengers pregaming)!
customer_reviews.author: Raj

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful cinematic experience.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector after a good deal of research for finding the keystone of our long-awaited home theater. We were blown away with the saturation, brightness, and clarity of this projector. We've been showing it off to family and friends and everyone has felt the same. It's just splendid. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Eggzakt

customer_reviews.title: Got what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a good 1080p projector. Started cheap and worked my way up. Tried Bigasuo and Xinda before this one. I am projecting directly on my wall and picture is clear enough for me. I also wanted high brightness since I do not have a dedicated dark theater room. It is usable during the day with all the lights off and blinds closed.
customer_reviews.author: RickJAR

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money for a higher end model
customer_reviews.text: Picture is generic and not as bright as advertised. I have a $700 Epson Home Cinema at home that dwarfs this one. BenQ makes better ones just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: emil fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this project about a week ago. The picture quality is amazing even in a well lit room. I hooked it up to a Roku to play movies and a Samsung sound bar for sound the only complaint I have as of now is the sound even hooked up to the sound bar the sound is low
customer_reviews.author: Jo war

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with the picture quality from this projector. Brightness is fantastic, even with 2 windows on either side fully open with mid day sun, i can still see the imagine clearly (ambient lighting, not directly on screen) Con: Only has vertical keystone, not 4 corner / horizontal keystone.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Clark

customer_reviews.title: Worth more than the price
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2017 model and it's so nice my 1000 uhd tv has been replaced.good during the day and great at night.this is my 3rd projector and the other 2 we're not even close.
customer_reviews.author: damion

customer_reviews.title: All I could ask for and much more!
customer_reviews.text: This projector is really all I will ever need in a projector at any price. The picture is bright and crystal clear. THE SOUND IS PERFECT WITH AN INEXPENSIVE $150 VIZIO SB3821-C6 38-Inch 2.1 Channel Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer
customer_reviews.author: John D Allen

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value together
customer_reviews.text: One awesome projector for the price. Super easy to set up and configure. Picture quality is amazing. I hooked it up to my surround sound stereo so I don’t use the built in speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Fashionably forward

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, I watch 3d movies, play ps4 games. Easy to set up and connect to TV & AVR. Picture quality is excellent for the price. I'd recommend
customer_reviews.author: Maor Halpern

customer_reviews.title: Nice Projector
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift from my family and I’m very impressed with it. I bought some PVC pipe and made a screen for outdoors. It’s a little cold so moved to the garage for testing it. The picture was made at 3pm Centeal time on a partly cloudy day. As you can see the picture is very good in daylight. I have a Bose speaker attached and a the sound is good for the game. I will probably buy a small amp for outdoor movie nights this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Norah

product_meta.title: BenQ MH530FHD 1080P Home Theater Projector | 3300 Lumens | 3D Compatible | Keystone | 1.2X Zoom
product_meta.description: Style:2017 ModelMain Specifications Resolution - 1080p, 1920 x 1080Brightness (ANSI lumens) - 3300Contrast Ratio (FOFO) - 15000: 1Speaker - 2W x 1All Specifications Display Projection System - DLP Resolution - 1080p, 1920 x 1080Resolution Support -VGA(640 x 480) to WUXGA_RB(1920 x 1200) *RB-Reduced Blanking Brightness (ANSI lumens) - 3300Contrast Ratio (FOFO) - 15000: 1Display Color - 30 Bits (1, 07 billion colors)Native Aspect Ratio - Native 16: 9 (5 aspect ratio selectable)Light Source - Lamplight Source Wattage - 203WLight Source Life - Normal 4500 hr., Economic 6000 hr., Smart Eco 10000 hr Optical Throw Ratio - 1. 37-1. 64 (60"@ 1. 82m)Zoom Ratio - 1. 2XLens - (7G all glass optical lens) F=2. 42-2. 62, f=19. 0-22. 65Keystone Adjustment - 1D, Vertical +/- 40 degrees Projection Offset - 107%&plasmin; 5%Clear Image Size (Diagonal) - 60"~300"Image Size - 30"~300"Horizontal Frequency - 15K~102KHzVertical Scan Rate - 23~120KHzAudioSpeaker - 2W x 1InterfacePC (D-Sub) - 2Monitor Out (D-Sub) - 1Composite Video in (RCA) - 1HDMI - 2 (1. 4a)USB Type mini B - 1 (Download & Page up/down)Audio in (3. 5mm Mini Jack) - 1Audio out (3. 5mm Mini Jack) - 1RS232 (DB-9pin) - 1IR Receiver - 1 (Front)Security Bar 1CompatibilityHDTV Compatibility - 480i, 480p, 576i, 576p, 720p, 1080i, 1080pVideo Compatibility - NTSC, PAL, SECAM Environment Power Supply - AC 100 to 240 V, 50/60 Typical Power Consumption - 252W(Normal)Standby Power Consumption - Acoustic Noise (Typ. /Eco. ) - 32/29 dB, C ski: Operating Temperature - 0~40℃Dimension and Weight Dimensions (W x H x D)(mm) - 13. 09 x 9. 5 x 3. 9 (in) | 332. 4 x 241. 3 x 99 (mm)Net Weight (Kg/ lbs.) - 2. 42 Kg(5. 33lb)Accessories (Standard)Carton - Brown carton, hand carry type Remote Control w/ Battery - 1 (RCX013)Power Cord (by region) - Yes User Manual CD - Yes Quick Start Guide - Yes Card (by region) - Yes GA(D-sub 15pin) Cable Yes Accessories (Optional)Spare Lamp Kit - Yes Universal Ceiling Mount - Yes3D Glasses Yes OSDOSD Language - 28L
feature_bullets: Clear and sharp picture quality: 1080p resolution renders a sharp image Only Ban projectors can deliver
Know the difference: our high Native contrast ratio delivers a greater picture than other projectors claiming a higher dynamic contrast Ratio
Long lasting: projector lamp life up to 10, 000 hours meaning you can enjoy 4 hours of entertainment everyday and have it last 10+ years
Bright for any environment: 3300 lumens gives you the ability to watch in your living room or backyard with ambient lighting
Flexible installation: vertical keystone correction and a 1. 2x zoom allows easy installation. Optimal sound If paired with external speakers
Optimal audio is paired with an external speaker through the 3. 5mm jack

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars399 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
